alert.note: Alert for Grady (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 11 at 7:06PM CDT until May 11 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN GRADY AND SOUTHEASTERN CANADIAN COUNTIES... At 706 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located near Tuttle, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Broadcast media confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Oklahoma City, Mustang, Tuttle, and Bridge Creek. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter, safe room, or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
